para: Quit &oof2;. If any non-trivial commands have been executed since the last time the command log was saved, the program will ask for confirmation before quitting and give the user a chance to save the log file.

This command itself is never automatically included in a log file. If you want &oof2; to quit after running a script, you can put OOF.File.Quit() in the script manually, or you can run &oof2; in batch mode.
